title: Drawing, "Design for a Marble Throne for the Statue of St. Peter, St. Peter's, Rome", 1754
medium: Pen and brown ink, graphite on cream laid paper.
markings: Fleur-de-lis in a circle surmounted by a V (cf. Heawood 1573)
inscribed:
On base of profile view in pen and brown ink : Bardiglio 
numbered in pen and black ink at upper right : 127
Across lower margin:  indication of scale
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli;  Mary Brandegee (Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee) [Lugt S. 1860c]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Marble throne for the Statue of St. Peter at St. Peter's in Rome; full-face and profile view shown.
